paragraph.paragraph:
.NET Type nodes populate Members pane of the Visual Studio .NET vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser and display the corresponding members of a types.xml.NET Type Node. To be consistent with Visual Studio .NET, the icons and names used to represent the type members are the same as detailed in the Visual Studio .NET vxgrfClassViewIcons 0 Class View and Object Browser Icons documentation.
../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures

In the Members pane, EiffelEnvision allows the .NET type member signatures to be expanded. Expanding the .NET member node will show the corresponding Eiffel for .NET ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeature name and it's full signature, in Eiffel-case. For more information on Eiffel-casing, see ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/90_assembly_formatting.xmlReferenced Assembly Type and Feature Name Conversion.

What is displayed under the .NET member nodes depends on the type of node. Method and Functions display only one Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeature, Properties show a getter and/or a setter ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures and finally Events show the add and remove event ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlfeatures.

The descriptions for both the .NET members and the Eiffel-cased features are almost identical, providing descriptions for the member and it's arguments and return value, when the vxconCommentingCode 0 XML documentation is available for the assembly. The .NET members will display decriptions based on the default Visual Studio .NET description langauge, typical Visual C#. The Eiffel feature descriptions will show the descriptions using the Eiffel-casing.

link.label: Visual Studio .NET Class View and Object Browser Icons
